author: @cnnnews18
title: This Delhi Couple Proves Dating Apps Can Lead To True 'Love Was First Sight' Moment | Video | Viral News - News18
text: A young couple’s journey towards marriage warmed people’s hearts, making them believe that true love can overcome the fickle nature of dating culture in today’s times. In a video shared by Instagram vlogger Vibhor Adnani, he revealed the sweet journey of two youngsters who connected via the Hinge dating application and developed true feelings for each other. “Are you guys dating? married? married, I’m assuming", Adnani asked during his visit to Khan Market in Delhi, to which the girl confirmed, “married, yes." The boy then confirmed they met via Hinge in Bengaluru. A surprised Adnani immediately asked, “Does Hinge really work?" The couple then replied: “It does, yeah. For us, it did. Yes." ‘What Happened On Your First Date?’ When the vlogger asked the couple to recall their first date, the two erupted in a wide grin before speaking about it fondly. The woman left the onus on her better half, saying, “I think he is going to tell better, yeah." The man then said, “We went to this local brewery in Bengaluru. She was 45 minutes late." As the husband pulled her leg, the wife interrupted, “The Bengaluru traffic, you know! You can’t blame me for that." “So the place was like a kilometre away from her place. And I was coming from like 15-20 kilometres (laughs). But yeah, nevertheless. Then I just saw her (coming) through the stairs and it was love at first sight," the husband said. Revealing her side of the story, the woman said that while they were dating, her husband kept insisting that they should get married. The man said he waited for her nod of approval for two years. “Yeah, eventually, he was able to convince me," she confirmed. “He made a lot of effort, by the way. He used to give me so many surprises. I would just open my door and he would be standing there." ‘What Made You Sure About Her?’ When asked what made him certain that she is the one he wants to spend his life with, the man said he went with his heart and knew “this was the right thing." To sum up his feelings, the husband quoted, “If I wanted something back from her, then it wouldn’t have been love. It would’ve been a transaction. When it’s love, you don’t expect the other person to love you the same way. I just wanted to give her what I had." On his patient perseverance during their dating life, the man said she didn’t say ‘no’ and that was a sign for him. “When you want something from the bottom of your heart, you have to go that extra mile. That’s the difference, I think, not everyone will do that." The couple’s dating journey and marriage would act as an inspiration for many dreaming of a similar love story to transpire in their lives.
